entry.title: Audit Log - Dashboard
entry.summary: The Audit Log is a quick view of the patients that have been viewed or updated, by whom, and at what time. Under Category, when a…
entry.content:
The Audit Log is a quick view of the patients that have been viewed or updated, by whom, and at what time.

Under Category, when a charge is edited with HOLD or Billed, the audit log will report that as a CHARGE instead of PATIENT.

Click Here To Learn About Scheduling

entry.title: Billing Dashboard
entry.summary: The Billing tab gives you insights into billing details. This chart shows the charges (encounter, fee, or purchase) by dollar amount. The default is monthly.
entry.content:
The Billing tab gives you insights into billing details.

Charges by Type

This chart shows the charges (encounter, fee, or purchase) by dollar amount. The default is monthly.

Charges by Code

This graph shows a breakdown of charges by code (98X12, 99X12, etc.).  The default is monthly.

Payments by Method

This chart shows the payments (Cash, Check, Debit or Credit, Direct Deposit, ERA, Payer or Refund) by dollar amount and percentage of total transactions. The default is monthly. 

Payments by Type

The graph now reflects the Payment Type (FFS, Balance, etc.) versus Payment Method (Cash, CC, etc.). The default is monthly.

Closed Charges by Tax Name

Closed Charges by Tax Name shows the total amount for charges with a tax amount greater than $0.00 grouped by Date of Service and sub-grouped by Tax Name. The default is monthly.

Closed Charges with Taxes

Closed Charges with Taxes is a list of charges with a tax amount greater than $0.00 along with the tax name, tax rate, and tax amount. 

Current Inventory Count

Current Inventory Count is a pie graph that groups active inventory items by name and quantity counts. The value this dashboard provides is a quick indicator of how many items they have on hand.
Items shown here are entered in the Inventory Management.

Low Inventory List

The Low Inventory List is a table that shows all active inventory items that are at or below the reorder threshold. The value this dashboard gives our customers is a run-down list of items they might need to buy to refill their inventory.
Items shown here can also be viewed in the Inventory Management with the low warning.

Patient Packages

Patient Packages is a list of all the active packages, by the individual patient, for the practice. View each package by patient's full name, MRN, package name, type, effective date, completed date, total visits, remaining visits, frequency, and whether it is a subscription, unlimited, or active.

Recurring Payments

Recurring Payments is a list of all the active recurring payments, by individual patients, for the practice. View each plan by patient's full name, MRN, whether it's active, the frequency, merchant account, card type, card number, start date, end date, last payment, next payment, amount, and total payments.

Payment Plans

Payment Plans is a list of all the active payment plans, by the individual patient, for the practice. View each plan by patient's full name, MRN, whether it's active, the frequency, merchant account, card type, card number, start date, last payment, next payment, amount, total payment, and open balance.

Click Here To Learn About the Audit Log

entry.title: Appointment & Encounters Dashboard
entry.summary: The Appointments & Encounters tab has seven areas. Appointments by Type shows the number and percentage of overall appointments by type of appointment booked. The…
entry.content:
The Appointments & Encounters tab has seven areas.

Appointments by Type

Appointments by Type shows the number and percentage of overall appointments by type of appointment booked. The default is monthly.

New Patients

New Patients shows the number of new patients versus the total patients seen. This chart is based on the number of patients Checked In and Checked Out. The default is monthly.

Appointments by Status

Appointments by Status shows the number of appointments for each status and the overall percentage of appointments by status. The default is daily.

Note:  Active is for scheduled patients that have not been checked in or out.

Payer Plan Distribution

Payer Plan Distribution provides you a way to visualize the mix of payers that they bill.

Encounters by Provider

Encounters by Provider shows the number of encounters by a provider. An encounter must be started for the provider to be included in the total. The default is monthly.

Patient Recall

Patient Recall is a list of patients that have had an appointment in the past 180 days but do not have a future appointment scheduled. View each patient by patient's full name, date of birth, MRN, total appointments scheduled, last appointment date, last appointment status, email address, and phone number.

Patient Birthdays

Patient Birthdays is a quick view of all the birthdays organized by month.

Creating A Birthday List

If your office likes to send out birthday messages, the Patient Birthdays list allows you to create a patient list by month.  If you want to export your list as a CSV file, you'll first need to Ungroup the list.

1. From the ellipsis, select Visual Settings.

2. Then use the minus to remove the Birthday Month from the Edit Groups and Apply. Note: You will not be able to export a CSV file if you skip this step.

3.  Now, to create a CSV for a single month, select Filters.

4. We will need to edit the current filter.  Click inside the field for the Birthday Month to modify.

T

5.  The filter is set for months 1-12.  Let's set it for January only.  Select EQUAL.

6.  Put the month you want to filter by and Apply.

7.  Now, you can export a CSV file.  From the ellipsis, select Export, then Raw Data (CSV).

 

Click Here to Learn about the Billing Dashboard

entry.title: Daily Dashboard
entry.summary: The Daily dashboard will be the default tab that opens when navigating to the Dashboard area. It has seven visuals that focus on the current day.
entry.content:
The Daily dashboard will be the default tab that opens when navigating to the Dashboard area. It has seven visuals that focus on the current day. The default time range is the current day (Start of Day - End of Day).  But it can be changed to other days to suit your needs.

Appointments by Provider

Shows the appointment counts grouped by Provider for active, checked in, and checked out appointments. Allows you to see the total of appointments by the provider and compare across all practice providers.

Appointments by Status

Shows appointment counts grouped by Appointment Start Time and sub-grouped by Appointment Status. Helpful to see hour-by-hour breakdowns on different days. The default is hourly. 

Charges by Billing Codes

Shows the charges and their volume grouped by Bill Type and sub-grouped by billing Code.  It gives you the ability to see what codes are used the most.

Payments by Method

Gives the total calculated payments (by method) grouped by Payment Type.

Encounters by Provider

This table groups encounters by the provider.  See what appointments the provider has if an encounter has been started and which encounters are signed.

Encounter Diagnosis

This bar graph shows the diagnosis codes used across all encounters.  It gives you an excellent comparison of codes to see which codes are used most.

Encounter Charges

This bar graph shows the total charge codes used in encounters. You can go into the details to see which encounters have been posted to the ledger and the dollar amounts.

Click Here To Learn About Appointment & Encounter Dashboard

entry.title: Inventory Management
entry.summary: Use the Inventory Management feature to automate your inventory. Keep track of your inventory on hand and set an inventory alert. Note: Available to Super…
entry.content:
Use the Inventory Management feature to automate your inventory.  Keep track of your inventory on hand and set an inventory alert.

Note: Available to Super Users only.

Add Item

At a minimum, complete the Item Name, Quantity, and Vendor Information.  If no vendor information exists for this item, select Add New Vendor.

Associate Charges and Purchases

For these items to automatically deduct, the item must be associated with a charge.

1. Click on Associate Charges & Purchases to add charges and purchases to a specific item.

2. From the slideout, select the charges and purchases to associate with this item.

3. Items added will show up along with the charges with which they are associated.  Every time that associated charge is posted, the quantity will adjust automatically.

Low Warning

When the inventory of an item hits your reorder number, a low warning symbol will appear to give you a visual that you need to reorder.

Note: Reordering is a manual process.

Monitoring Inventory

Inventory items can also be viewed in the Dashboard Billing tab.

All current inventory will show in a pie graph.

All Low Inventory will show in a list.

entry.title: ChiroTouch Community
entry.summary: Welcome! We are so excited to have you as part of our ChiroTouch family, so we want to show you around our Community to get…
entry.content:
Welcome! We are so excited to have you as part of our ChiroTouch family, so we want to show you around our Community to get you acquainted with everything you can do..

ChiroTouch Community is a great place to learn. There are articles to read, videos to watch, courses to take, and discussions to read and participate in.

As you navigate around Community, you will see the search box, where you can perform a specific search, and tiles you can click on to find items based on topic. At the top of the screen, you will see Ideas and Cases, among other menu items. In the Ideas section, you can suggest features and improvements to the app that you’d like to see, and in the Cases section, you can create a Support case for our agents to follow up with you.

When you come into Community seeking answers, you can create your own discussion if you don’t find a relevant one. Feel free to answer discussion questions others have asked! Also keep in mind that any discussion you create and any comments you leave on other discussions will be seen by members of the entire ChiroTouch Community. We strongly suggest that you don’t add personal information like a phone number or email address in your comments.

When you search for a keyword or feature, the system will return articles that potentially address your question. If you click View More, you can see more items fitting your search parameters than show on the initial result screen.
 
If you do not see what you are looking for, your next step would be to ask Mabel, our chatbot. Click Chat with an Expert in the bottom right corner and ask her a question. She will return relevant articles or videos for you to see. You can also click Chat with an Expert to be connected directly to someone on our Support team to assist you with your question. Note that live support is only available between 7 AM-5 PM Pacific time.
 
You can create your own Support case any time you need to. When you click Create Case, you have the opportunity to search our knowledge base or create a case. Remember, the more information you provide when creating a case, the better we know which department needs to follow up. If you are receiving an error, either take a screenshot and attach it to the case or provide the full text of the error. Please only create one case per issue as creating multiple cases for the same issue can cause a delay in having Support reach out.

We also have an Ideas area where you can go to see if someone has already suggested a feature you’d like to see. Definitely upvote the ones you like! If you do not see an existing suggestion for the feature you want, you can create an idea yourself. This is where our developers come to get ideas for future features we should be working on, so your ideas and upvotes are important!

If you are having an outage or work stoppage issue, you should contact our Support team for reporting and resolution rather than posting a discussion. Community discussions are monitored, and a real person is answering your questions, but we may not get to your question quickly if you need immediate assistance.

We have big plans for our Community as we grow. Be on the lookout for our new Spotlight area coming soon!

entry.title: CT InForms - Review
entry.summary: Now you can Review your forms to see what changes were made. Review is also where you are able to match forms to patients that…
entry.content:
Now you can Review your forms to see what changes were made.  Review is also where you are able to match forms to patients that were not previously in your ChiroTouch.

No Match Found

If you use a generic URL link on your website or provide the scannable QR code for your patient intake, you will get patients that do not match. 

You can Search for the patient.

Once the patient is added to your ChiroTouch with minimal information, the patient will show up in the search list and can be matched.  At that time, the Intake Form will be imported into ChiroTouch.

You will be asked to confirm that you want to match the patient to a particular record.

New Primary Insurance Created

A new Primary insurance record will be created if any payer is selected from the pre-set Insurance Payer list other than UNLISTED and all the required insurance fields are filled out.

  • Insurance Payer (above)
  • Insurance Plan Name
  • ID Policy Number
  • Relationship to Patient
  • Insured First & Last Name
  • Insured Date of Birth

New Insurance Record Created

If there are changes to either of the fields for Payer ID or Policy Number, a new Primary insurance record will be created.  

Learn More About CT InForms Reports

entry.title: CT Engage - Product Analytics
entry.summary: CT Engage comes with analytics to help you know how effective your communication is with your clients. We provide analytics to keep track of how…
entry.content:
CT Engage comes with analytics to help you know how effective your communication is with your clients.

We provide analytics to keep track of how many messages you send and receive over the course of a month, how many appointments were confirmed, and how many patients made an appointment due to a recall notice.

Take Me To Location Settings

entry.title: CT Verify
entry.summary: CT Verify is an ancillary service that allows you to check a patient's insurance for eligibility. You can automate it to check for you at…
entry.content:
CT Verify is an ancillary service that allows you to check a patient's insurance for eligibility.  You can automate it to check for you at intervals you choose or use the Check Eligibility button in Check In, Check Out, and in the patient's insurance to do a manual check any time.  When you're ready to sign-up or want more information, contact a specialist.

NOTE: You will need to have ChiroTouch Advanced to enable this service.

Getting Started

This is your guide to setting up your Payer Plans to use Real-Time Eligibility.

Using It

Learn the basics of using CT Verify daily, including adding it to patient insurance plans and viewing eligibility results.

entry.title: CT Verify - Getting Started
entry.summary: Congratulations! You've decided to subscribe to CT Verify. Once our support team activates CT Verify on your account, a Real-Time Eligibility tab will be available…
entry.content:
Congratulations!  You've decided to subscribe to CT Verify. Once our support team activates CT Verify on your account, a Real-Time Eligibility tab will be available for each payer. 

If you are already set up with Change Healthcare Clearinghouse and your settings are saved in ChiroTouch, you can now set up your Payer Plans.

Set Up Payer Plans  

In Payer Plan Maintenance, select the payer you'd like to set up. In the Update Payer Plan slideout, select the new tab for Real-Time Eligibility.  

You'll need to enable Real-Time Eligibility for each payer. By default, Real-Time Eligibility is disabled.

You will need to fill in a Real-Time Eligibility ID or the Real-Time Eligibility Portal ID.

Get Real-Time Eligibility Information 

To get this information for each payer, you'll need to be logged in to the Change Healthcare ConnectCenter.  Under Payer Tools, select Payer Search.

Use Payer ID to Search

If you know the Payer ID, that is the easiest way to search. From the Payer Search, you type in the Payer ID, select Eligibility and Professional, then SEARCH.  The results will be returned for only that particular payer.

The PAYER ID search returned results for a single-payer, all with the same Realtime Payer ID. 

Search All Payers

If you want to search the entire list of payers, from Payer Search, you can select Eligibility and Professional, then SEARCH.

You'll get a list of all payers. 

The two columns to look at are Realtime Payer ID and Connectivity Available. 

  • If a payer you use has a RealTime Payer ID, you can put those results for your Real-Time Eligibility ID.
  • Check the Connectivity Available column if your payer is missing a RealTime Payer ID. If it has a P in that column, follow the instructions to obtain and enter the Portal ID.

Real-Time Eligibility ID

If you use a payer with the Realtime Payer ID listed, you can update the Payer Plan.

Select Real-Time Eligibility ID and enter the Realtime Payer ID from the search results for that payer.

Portal ID

To obtain the Portal ID, click on the CPID of the payer.

A new window will open will all of that Payer Details.

Type the Eligibility Portal ID into the blank for PORTAL ID from the Payment Details page. You'll also need to put in your Portal Username and Portal Password.

NOTE: Use your Portal Username and Portal Password you have obtained for each payer.  If you don't have a username and password for a particular payer, then click View to sign-up with that payer.

Click Here to Learn How to Use CT Verify.
